parameter.name: ctl_bw
parameter.long_desc: Speed controller bandwidth, in Hz. Higher values result in faster speed and current rise times, but may result in overshoot and higher current consumption. For fixed-wing aircraft, this value should be less than 50 Hz; for multirotors, values up to 100 Hz may provide improvements in responsiveness.

parameter.name: ctl_dir
parameter.long_desc: Motor spin direction as detected during initial enumeration. Use 0 or 1 to reverse direction.

parameter.name: ctl_gain
parameter.long_desc: Speed (RPM) controller gain. Determines controller aggressiveness; units are amp-seconds per radian. Systems with higher rotational inertia (large props) will need gain increased; systems with low rotational inertia (small props) may need gain decreased. Higher values result in faster response, but may result in oscillation and excessive overshoot. Lower values result in a slower, smoother response.

parameter.name: ctl_hz_idle
parameter.long_desc: Idle speed (e Hz)

parameter.name: ctl_start_rate
parameter.long_desc: Spin-up rate (e Hz/s)

parameter.name: esc_index
parameter.short_desc: Index of this ESC in throttle command messages.
parameter.long_desc: Index of this ESC in throttle command messages.

parameter.name: id_ext_status
parameter.long_desc: Extended status ID

parameter.name: int_ext_status
parameter.long_desc: Extended status interval (µs)

parameter.name: int_status
parameter.long_desc: ESC status interval (µs)

parameter.name: mot_i_max
parameter.long_desc: Motor current limit in amps. This determines the maximum current controller setpoint, as well as the maximum allowable current setpoint slew rate. This value should generally be set to the continuous current rating listed in the motor’s specification sheet, or set equal to the motor’s specified continuous power divided by the motor voltage limit.

parameter.name: mot_kv
parameter.short_desc: Motor Kv in RPM per volt
parameter.long_desc: Motor Kv in RPM per volt. This can be taken from the motor’s specification sheet; accuracy will help control performance but some deviation from the specified value is acceptable.

parameter.name: mot_ls
parameter.short_desc: READ ONLY: Motor inductance in henries.
parameter.long_desc: READ ONLY: Motor inductance in henries. This is measured on start-up.

parameter.name: mot_num_poles
parameter.long_desc: Number of motor poles. Used to convert mechanical speeds to electrical speeds. This number should be taken from the motor’s specification sheet.

parameter.name: mot_rs
parameter.short_desc: READ ONLY: Motor resistance in ohms
parameter.long_desc: READ ONLY: Motor resistance in ohms. This is measured on start-up. When tuning a new motor, check that this value is approximately equal to the value shown in the motor’s specification sheet.

parameter.name: mot_v_accel
parameter.long_desc: Acceleration limit (V)

parameter.name: mot_v_max
parameter.long_desc: Motor voltage limit in volts. The current controller’s commanded voltage will never exceed this value. Note that this may safely be above the nominal voltage of the motor; to determine the actual motor voltage limit, divide the motor’s rated power by the motor current limit.

parameter.name: gnss.dyn_model
parameter.long_desc: Dynamic model used in the GNSS positioning engine. 0 – Automotive, 1 – Sea, 2 – Airborne.

parameter.name: gnss.old_fix_msg
parameter.long_desc: Broadcast the old (deprecated) GNSS fix message uavcan.equipment.gnss.Fix alongside the new alternative uavcan.equipment.gnss.Fix2. It is recommended to disable this feature to reduce the CAN bus traffic.

parameter.name: gnss.warn_dimens
parameter.long_desc: Set the device health to Warning if the dimensionality of the GNSS solution is less than this value. 3 for the full (3D) solution, 2 for planar (2D) solution, 1 for time-only solution, 0 disables the feature.

parameter.name: gnss.warn_sats
parameter.long_desc: Set the device health to Warning if the number of satellites used in the GNSS solution is below this threshold. Zero disables the feature

parameter.name: uavcan.pubp-pres
parameter.long_desc: Set the device health to Warning if the number of satellites used in the GNSS solution is below this threshold. Zero disables the feature

parameter.name: ADSB_CALLSIGN_1
parameter.long_desc: Sets first 4 characters of a total of 8. Valid characters are A-Z, 0-9, " ". Example "PX4 " -> 1347957792 For CALLSIGN shorter than 8 characters use the null terminator at the end '\0'.

parameter.name: ADSB_CALLSIGN_2
parameter.long_desc: Sets second 4 characters of a total of 8. Valid characters are A-Z, 0-9, " " only. Example "TEST" -> 1413829460 For CALLSIGN shorter than 8 characters use the null terminator at the end '\0'.

parameter.name: ADSB_EMERGC
parameter.long_desc: Sets the vehicle emergency state

parameter.name: ADSB_EMIT_TYPE
parameter.long_desc: Configure the emitter type of the vehicle.

parameter.name: ADSB_GPS_OFF_LAT
parameter.long_desc: Sets GPS lataral offset encoding

parameter.name: ADSB_GPS_OFF_LON
parameter.long_desc: Sets GPS longitudinal offset encoding

parameter.name: ADSB_ICAO_ID
parameter.long_desc: Defines the ICAO ID of the vehicle

parameter.name: ADSB_ICAO_SPECL
parameter.long_desc: This vehicle is always tracked. Use 0 to disable.

parameter.name: ADSB_IDENT
parameter.long_desc: Enable Identification of Position feature

parameter.name: ADSB_LEN_WIDTH
parameter.long_desc: Report the length and width of the vehicle in meters. In most cases, use '1' for the smallest vehicle size.

parameter.name: ADSB_LIST_MAX
parameter.long_desc: Change number of targets to track

parameter.name: ADSB_MAX_SPEED
parameter.long_desc: Informs ADSB vehicles of this vehicle's max speed capability

parameter.name: ADSB_SQUAWK
parameter.long_desc: This parameter defines the squawk code. Value should be between 0000 and 7777.

parameter.name: BAT1_CAPACITY
parameter.long_desc: Defines the capacity of battery 1 in mAh.

parameter.name: BAT1_N_CELLS
parameter.long_desc: Defines the number of cells the attached battery consists of.

parameter.name: BAT1_R_INTERNAL
parameter.short_desc: Explicitly defines the per cell internal resistance for battery 1
parameter.long_desc: If non-negative, then this will be used instead of the online estimated internal resistance.

parameter.name: BAT1_SOURCE
parameter.long_desc: This parameter controls the source of battery data. The value 'Power Module' means that measurements are expected to come from a power module. If the value is set to 'External' then the system expects to receive mavlink battery status messages. If the value is set to 'ESCs', the battery information are taken from the esc_status message. This requires the ESC to provide both voltage as well as current.

parameter.name: BAT1_V_CHARGED
parameter.long_desc: Defines the voltage where a single cell of the battery is considered full. For a more accurate estimate set this below the nominal voltage of e.g. 4.2V

parameter.name: BAT1_V_EMPTY
parameter.long_desc: Defines the voltage where a single cell of the battery is considered empty. The voltage should be chosen above the steep dropoff at 3.5V. A typical lithium battery can only be discharged under high load down to 10% before it drops off to a voltage level damaging the cells.

parameter.name: BAT2_CAPACITY
parameter.long_desc: Defines the capacity of battery 2 in mAh.

parameter.name: BAT2_N_CELLS
parameter.long_desc: Defines the number of cells the attached battery consists of.

parameter.name: BAT2_R_INTERNAL
parameter.short_desc: Explicitly defines the per cell internal resistance for battery 2
parameter.long_desc: If non-negative, then this will be used instead of the online estimated internal resistance.

parameter.name: BAT2_SOURCE
parameter.long_desc: This parameter controls the source of battery data. The value 'Power Module' means that measurements are expected to come from a power module. If the value is set to 'External' then the system expects to receive mavlink battery status messages. If the value is set to 'ESCs', the battery information are taken from the esc_status message. This requires the ESC to provide both voltage as well as current.

parameter.name: BAT2_V_CHARGED
parameter.long_desc: Defines the voltage where a single cell of the battery is considered full. For a more accurate estimate set this below the nominal voltage of e.g. 4.2V

parameter.name: BAT2_V_EMPTY
parameter.long_desc: Defines the voltage where a single cell of the battery is considered empty. The voltage should be chosen above the steep dropoff at 3.5V. A typical lithium battery can only be discharged under high load down to 10% before it drops off to a voltage level damaging the cells.

parameter.name: BAT3_CAPACITY
parameter.long_desc: Defines the capacity of battery 3 in mAh.

parameter.name: BAT3_N_CELLS
parameter.long_desc: Defines the number of cells the attached battery consists of.

parameter.name: BAT3_R_INTERNAL
parameter.short_desc: Explicitly defines the per cell internal resistance for battery 3
parameter.long_desc: If non-negative, then this will be used instead of the online estimated internal resistance.

parameter.name: BAT3_SOURCE
parameter.long_desc: This parameter controls the source of battery data. The value 'Power Module' means that measurements are expected to come from a power module. If the value is set to 'External' then the system expects to receive mavlink battery status messages. If the value is set to 'ESCs', the battery information are taken from the esc_status message. This requires the ESC to provide both voltage as well as current.

parameter.name: BAT3_V_CHARGED
parameter.long_desc: Defines the voltage where a single cell of the battery is considered full. For a more accurate estimate set this below the nominal voltage of e.g. 4.2V

parameter.name: BAT3_V_EMPTY
parameter.long_desc: Defines the voltage where a single cell of the battery is considered empty. The voltage should be chosen above the steep dropoff at 3.5V. A typical lithium battery can only be discharged under high load down to 10% before it drops off to a voltage level damaging the cells.

parameter.name: BAT_AVRG_CURRENT
parameter.long_desc: This value is used to initialize the in-flight average current estimation, which in turn is used for estimating remaining flight time and RTL triggering.

parameter.name: BAT_CRIT_THR
parameter.long_desc: Sets the threshold when the battery will be reported as critically low. This has to be lower than the low threshold. This threshold commonly will trigger RTL.

parameter.name: BAT_EMERGEN_THR
parameter.long_desc: Sets the threshold when the battery will be reported as dangerously low. This has to be lower than the critical threshold. This threshold commonly will trigger landing.

parameter.name: BAT_LOW_THR
parameter.long_desc: Sets the threshold when the battery will be reported as low. This has to be higher than the critical threshold.

parameter.name: CBRK_BUZZER
parameter.long_desc: Setting this parameter to 782097 will disable the buzzer audio notification. Setting this parameter to 782090 will disable the startup tune, while keeping all others enabled.

parameter.name: CBRK_FLIGHTTERM
parameter.long_desc: Setting this parameter to 121212 will disable the flight termination action if triggered by the FailureDetector logic or if FMU is lost. This circuit breaker does not affect the RC loss, data link loss, geofence, and takeoff failure detection safety logic.

parameter.name: CBRK_IO_SAFETY
parameter.long_desc: Setting this parameter to 22027 will disable IO safety. WARNING: ENABLING THIS CIRCUIT BREAKER IS AT OWN RISK

parameter.name: CBRK_SUPPLY_CHK
parameter.short_desc: Circuit breaker for power supply check
parameter.long_desc: Setting this parameter to 894281 will disable the power valid checks in the commander. WARNING: ENABLING THIS CIRCUIT BREAKER IS AT OWN RISK

parameter.name: CBRK_USB_CHK
parameter.short_desc: Circuit breaker for USB link check
parameter.long_desc: Setting this parameter to 197848 will disable the USB connected checks in the commander, setting it to 0 keeps them enabled (recommended). We are generally recommending to not fly with the USB link connected and production vehicles should set this parameter to zero to prevent users from flying USB powered. However, for R&D purposes it has proven over the years to work just fine.

parameter.name: CBRK_VTOLARMING
parameter.short_desc: Circuit breaker for arming in fixed-wing mode check
parameter.long_desc: Setting this parameter to 159753 will enable arming in fixed-wing mode for VTOLs. WARNING: ENABLING THIS CIRCUIT BREAKER IS AT OWN RISK

parameter.name: FW_AIRSPD_FLP_SC
parameter.long_desc: Factor applied to the minimum and stall airspeed when flaps are fully deployed.

parameter.name: FW_AIRSPD_MAX
parameter.long_desc: The maximal airspeed (calibrated airspeed) the user is able to command.

parameter.name: FW_AIRSPD_MIN
parameter.long_desc: The minimal airspeed (calibrated airspeed) the user is able to command. Further, if the airspeed falls below this value, the TECS controller will try to increase airspeed more aggressively. Has to be set according to the vehicle's stall speed (which should be set in FW_AIRSPD_STALL), with some margin between the stall speed and minimum airspeed. This value corresponds to the desired minimum speed with the default load factor (level flight, default weight), and is automatically adpated to the current load factor (calculated from roll setpoint and WEIGHT_GROSS/WEIGHT_BASE).

parameter.name: FW_AIRSPD_STALL
parameter.long_desc: The stall airspeed (calibrated airspeed) of the vehicle. It is used for airspeed sensor failure detection and for the control surface scaling airspeed limits.

parameter.name: FW_AIRSPD_TRIM
parameter.long_desc: The trim CAS (calibrated airspeed) of the vehicle. If an airspeed controller is active, this is the default airspeed setpoint that the controller will try to achieve. This value corresponds to the trim airspeed with the default load factor (level flight, default weight).

parameter.name: FW_SERVICE_CEIL
parameter.long_desc: Altitude in standard atmosphere at which the vehicle in normal configuration (WEIGHT_BASE) is still able to achieve a maximum climb rate of 0.5m/s at maximum throttle (FW_THR_MAX). Used to compensate for air density in FW_T_CLMB_MAX. Set negative to disable.

parameter.name: FW_THR_ASPD_MAX
parameter.long_desc: Required throttle (at sea level, standard atmosphere) for level flight at maximum airspeed FW_AIRSPD_MAX Set to 0 to disable mapping of airspeed to trim throttle.

parameter.name: FW_THR_ASPD_MIN
parameter.long_desc: Required throttle (at sea level, standard atmosphere) for level flight at minimum airspeed FW_AIRSPD_MIN Set to 0 to disable mapping of airspeed to trim throttle below FW_AIRSPD_TRIM.

parameter.name: FW_THR_TRIM
parameter.long_desc: Required throttle (at sea level, standard atmosphere) for level flight at FW_AIRSPD_TRIM

parameter.name: FW_T_CLMB_MAX
parameter.long_desc: This is the maximum calibrated climb rate that the aircraft can achieve with the throttle set to FW_THR_MAX and the airspeed set to the trim value. For electric aircraft make sure this number can be achieved towards the end of flight when the battery voltage has reduced.

parameter.name: FW_T_SINK_MIN
parameter.long_desc: This is the minimum calibrated sink rate of the aircraft with the throttle set to THR_MIN and flown at the same airspeed as used to measure FW_T_CLMB_MAX.

parameter.name: WEIGHT_BASE
parameter.long_desc: This is the weight of the vehicle at which it's performance limits were derived. A zero or negative value disables trim throttle and minimum airspeed compensation based on weight.

parameter.name: WEIGHT_GROSS
parameter.long_desc: This is the actual weight of the vehicle at any time. This value will differ from WEIGHT_BASE in case weight was added or removed from the base weight. Examples are the addition of payloads or larger batteries. A zero or negative value disables trim throttle and minimum airspeed compensation based on weight.

parameter.name: MC_AIRMODE
parameter.long_desc: The air-mode enables the mixer to increase the total thrust of the multirotor in order to keep attitude and rate control even at low and high throttle. This function should be disabled during tuning as it will help the controller to diverge if the closed-loop is unstable (i.e. the vehicle is not tuned yet). Enabling air-mode for yaw requires the use of an arming switch.

parameter.name: CP_DELAY
parameter.short_desc: Average delay of the range sensor message plus the tracking delay of the position controller in seconds
parameter.long_desc: Only used in Position mode.

parameter.name: CP_DIST
parameter.short_desc: Minimum distance the vehicle should keep to all obstacles
parameter.long_desc: Only used in Position mode. Collision avoidance is disabled by setting this parameter to a negative value

parameter.name: CP_GO_NO_DATA
parameter.short_desc: Boolean to allow moving into directions where there is no sensor data (outside FOV)
parameter.long_desc: Only used in Position mode.

parameter.name: CP_GUIDE_ANG
parameter.short_desc: Angle left/right from the commanded setpoint by which the collision prevention algorithm can choose to change the setpoint direction
parameter.long_desc: Only used in Position mode.

parameter.name: WV_ROLL_MIN
parameter.short_desc: Minimum roll angle setpoint for weathervane controller to demand a yaw-rate

parameter.name: WV_YRATE_MAX
parameter.short_desc: Maximum yawrate the weathervane controller is allowed to demand

parameter.name: THR_MDL_FAC
parameter.short_desc: Thrust to motor control signal model parameter
parameter.long_desc: Parameter used to model the nonlinear relationship between motor control signal (e.g. PWM) and static thrust. The model is: rel_thrust = factor * rel_signal^2 + (1-factor) * rel_signal, where rel_thrust is the normalized thrust between 0 and 1, and rel_signal is the relative motor control signal between 0 and 1.

parameter.name: PP_LOOKAHD_GAIN
parameter.short_desc: Tuning parameter for the pure pursuit controller
parameter.long_desc: Lower value -> More aggressive controller (beware overshoot/oscillations)

parameter.name: PP_LOOKAHD_MAX
parameter.short_desc: Maximum lookahead distance for the pure pursuit controller

parameter.name: PP_LOOKAHD_MIN
parameter.short_desc: Minimum lookahead distance for the pure pursuit controller

parameter.name: RO_YAW_P
parameter.short_desc: Proportional gain for closed loop yaw controller

parameter.name: RO_YAW_ACCEL_LIM
parameter.long_desc: Used to cap how quickly the magnitude of yaw rate setpoints can increase. Set to -1 to disable.

parameter.name: RO_YAW_DECEL_LIM
parameter.long_desc: Used to cap how quickly the magnitude of yaw rate setpoints can decrease. Set to -1 to disable.

parameter.name: RO_YAW_EXPO
parameter.long_desc: Exponential factor for tuning the input curve shape. 0 Purely linear input curve 1 Purely cubic input curve

parameter.name: RO_YAW_RATE_CORR
parameter.long_desc: Multiplicative correction factor for the feedforward mapping of the yaw rate controller. Increase this value (x > 1) if the measured yaw rate is lower than the setpoint, decrease (0 < x < 1) otherwise. Note: Tuning this is particularly useful for skid-steered rovers, or rovers with misaligned wheels/steering axes that cause a lot of friction when turning.

parameter.name: RO_YAW_RATE_I
parameter.short_desc: Integral gain for closed loop yaw rate controller

parameter.name: RO_YAW_RATE_LIM
parameter.long_desc: Used to cap yaw rate setpoints and map controller inputs to yaw rate setpoints in Acro, Stabilized and Position mode.

parameter.name: RO_YAW_RATE_P
parameter.short_desc: Proportional gain for closed loop yaw rate controller

parameter.name: RO_YAW_RATE_TH
parameter.long_desc: The minimum threshold for the yaw rate measurement not to be interpreted as zero.

parameter.name: RO_YAW_STICK_DZ
parameter.long_desc: Percentage of stick input range that will be interpreted as zero around the stick centered value.

parameter.name: RO_YAW_SUPEXPO
parameter.long_desc: "Superexponential" factor for refining the input curve shape tuned using RO_YAW_EXPO. 0 Pure Expo function 0.7 reasonable shape enhancement for intuitive stick feel 0.95 very strong bent input curve only near maxima have effect

parameter.name: RO_ACCEL_LIM
parameter.long_desc: Set to -1 to disable. For mecanum rovers this limit is used for longitudinal and lateral acceleration.

parameter.name: RO_DECEL_LIM
parameter.long_desc: Set to -1 to disable. Note that if it is disabled the rover will not slow down when approaching waypoints in auto modes. For mecanum rovers this limit is used for longitudinal and lateral deceleration.

parameter.name: RO_JERK_LIM
parameter.long_desc: Set to -1 to disable. Note that if it is disabled the rover will not slow down when approaching waypoints in auto modes. For mecanum rovers this limit is used for longitudinal and lateral jerk.

parameter.name: RO_MAX_THR_SPEED
parameter.short_desc: Speed the rover drives at maximum throttle
parameter.long_desc: Used to linearly map speeds [m/s] to throttle values [-1. 1].

parameter.name: RO_SPEED_I
parameter.short_desc: Integral gain for ground speed controller

parameter.name: RO_SPEED_LIM
parameter.long_desc: Used to cap speed setpoints and map controller inputs to speed setpoints in Position mode.

parameter.name: RO_SPEED_P
parameter.short_desc: Proportional gain for ground speed controller

parameter.name: RO_SPEED_RED
parameter.short_desc: Tuning parameter for the speed reduction based on the course error
parameter.long_desc: Reduced_speed = RO_MAX_THR_SPEED * (1 - normalized_course_error * RO_SPEED_RED) The normalized course error is the angle between the current course and the bearing setpoint interpolated from [0, 180] -> [0, 1]. Higher value -> More speed reduction. Note: This is also used to calculate the speed at which the vehicle arrives at a waypoint in auto modes. Set to -1 to disable bearing error based speed reduction.

parameter.name: RO_SPEED_TH
parameter.long_desc: Set to -1 to disable. The minimum threshold for the speed measurement not to be interpreted as zero.

parameter.name: SYS_AUTOCONFIG
parameter.long_desc: Set to 1 to reset parameters on next system startup (setting defaults). Platform-specific values are used if available. RC* parameters are preserved.

parameter.name: SYS_AUTOSTART
parameter.long_desc: CHANGING THIS VALUE REQUIRES A RESTART. Defines the auto-start script used to bootstrap the system.

parameter.name: SYS_BL_UPDATE
parameter.long_desc: If enabled, update the bootloader on the next boot. WARNING: do not cut the power during an update process, otherwise you will have to recover using some alternative method (e.g. JTAG). Instructions: - Insert an SD card - Enable this parameter - Reboot the board (plug the power or send a reboot command) - Wait until the board comes back up (or at least 2 minutes) - If it does not come back, check the file bootlog.txt on the SD card

parameter.name: SYS_CAL_ACCEL
parameter.short_desc: Enable auto start of accelerometer thermal calibration at the next power up
parameter.long_desc: 0 : Set to 0 to do nothing 1 : Set to 1 to start a calibration at next boot This parameter is reset to zero when the temperature calibration starts. default (0, no calibration)

parameter.name: SYS_CAL_BARO
parameter.short_desc: Enable auto start of barometer thermal calibration at the next power up
parameter.long_desc: 0 : Set to 0 to do nothing 1 : Set to 1 to start a calibration at next boot This parameter is reset to zero when the temperature calibration starts. default (0, no calibration)

parameter.name: SYS_CAL_GYRO
parameter.short_desc: Enable auto start of rate gyro thermal calibration at the next power up
parameter.long_desc: 0 : Set to 0 to do nothing 1 : Set to 1 to start a calibration at next boot This parameter is reset to zero when the temperature calibration starts. default (0, no calibration)

parameter.name: SYS_CAL_TDEL
parameter.short_desc: Required temperature rise during thermal calibration
parameter.long_desc: A temperature increase greater than this value is required during calibration. Calibration will complete for each sensor when the temperature increase above the starting temperature exceeds the value set by SYS_CAL_TDEL. If the temperature rise is insufficient, the calibration will continue indefinitely and the board will need to be repowered to exit.

parameter.name: SYS_CAL_TMAX
parameter.short_desc: Maximum starting temperature for thermal calibration
parameter.long_desc: Temperature calibration will not start if the temperature of any sensor is higher than the value set by SYS_CAL_TMAX.

parameter.name: SYS_CAL_TMIN
parameter.short_desc: Minimum starting temperature for thermal calibration
parameter.long_desc: Temperature calibration for each sensor will ignore data if the temperature is lower than the value set by SYS_CAL_TMIN.

parameter.name: SYS_FAC_CAL_MODE
parameter.long_desc: If enabled, future sensor calibrations will be stored to /fs/mtd_caldata. Note: this is only supported on boards with a separate calibration storage /fs/mtd_caldata.

parameter.name: SYS_FAILURE_EN
parameter.long_desc: If enabled allows MAVLink INJECT_FAILURE commands. WARNING: the failures can easily cause crashes and are to be used with caution!

parameter.name: SYS_HAS_BARO
parameter.short_desc: Control if the vehicle has a barometer
parameter.long_desc: Disable this if the board has no barometer, such as some of the Omnibus F4 SD variants. If disabled, the preflight checks will not check for the presence of a barometer.

parameter.name: SYS_HAS_GPS
parameter.short_desc: Control if the vehicle has a GPS
parameter.long_desc: Disable this if the system has no GPS. If disabled, the sensors hub will not process sensor_gps, and GPS will not be available for the rest of the system.

parameter.name: SYS_HAS_MAG
parameter.short_desc: Control if and how many magnetometers are expected
parameter.long_desc: 0: System has no magnetometer, preflight checks should pass without one. 1-N: Require the presence of N magnetometer sensors for check to pass.

parameter.name: SYS_HAS_NUM_ASPD
parameter.short_desc: Control if the vehicle has an airspeed sensor
parameter.long_desc: Set this to 0 if the board has no airspeed sensor. If set to 0, the preflight checks will not check for the presence of an airspeed sensor.

parameter.name: SYS_HAS_NUM_DIST
parameter.short_desc: Number of distance sensors to check being available
parameter.long_desc: The preflight check will fail if fewer than this number of distance sensors with valid data is present. Disable the check with 0.

parameter.name: SYS_HAS_NUM_OF
parameter.short_desc: Number of optical flow sensors required to be available
parameter.long_desc: The preflight check will fail if fewer than this number of optical flow sensors with valid data are present.

parameter.name: SYS_HITL
parameter.short_desc: Enable HITL/SIH mode on next boot
parameter.long_desc: While enabled the system will boot in Hardware-In-The-Loop (HITL) or Simulation-In-Hardware (SIH) mode and not enable all sensors and checks. When disabled the same vehicle can be flown normally. Set to 'external HITL', if the system should perform as if it were a real vehicle (the only difference to a real system is then only the parameter value, which can be used for log analysis).

parameter.name: SYS_PARAM_VER
parameter.long_desc: This is used internally only: an airframe configuration might set an expected parameter version value via PARAM_DEFAULTS_VER. This is checked on bootup against SYS_PARAM_VER, and if they do not match, parameters are reset and reloaded from the airframe configuration.

parameter.name: SYS_RGB_MAXBRT
parameter.long_desc: Set to 0 to disable, 1 for maximum brightness

parameter.name: WV_GAIN
parameter.long_desc: The desired gain to convert roll sp into yaw rate sp.
